STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
July 16, 2025
PATRICK MCKEAGE
BAY PINES CENTER
2425 N. 30TH STREET,
ESCANABA, MI, 49829-9203
Re: License #: CS210200969
SI #: 2025SIC0000795
Dear Mr. McKeage:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan must be completed and routed in CWLM. If you desire technical assistance in
addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000795
Special Investigation Intake Date: June 13, 2025
License #: CS210200969
Licensee Group Organization: Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services
Licensee Designee: Demetrius Starling
Chief Administrator: PATRICK MCKEAGE
Agency Name: BAY PINES CENTER
Agency Address: 2425 N. 30TH STREET
ESCANABA, MI 49829-9203
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 08/20/2025
Capacity: 35
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose

7/10/2025 Email Documentation received or sent

1

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142
Section Health services; policies and procedures.
Description (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(e) Dispensing medication.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A youth approached the medication cart and was able to grab
medications that were prepared for another youth. Youth ingested
1 tablet of Venlafaxine ER 75mg, and 1 tablet of Oxtellar 600mg
before cart was removed. Poison control was notified, and staff
monitored the youth.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 6/17/2025 and
had no further concerns or information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
6/25/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A
reported he took medications that were not prescribed to him.
Youth A reported Nurse was on the unit with the medication cart to
administer medications. He went up to the medication cart and
took medications that were sitting on top to be dispensed to other
youth. After he took the medications, he was put in his bedroom
until the next morning. Youth A reported each unit has a
medication cart and depending on which staff passes medications
determines what process occurs. Youth A reported typically youth
go into their bedrooms prior to medications being administered
and then one youth is called to come out at a time to take their
medications. Youth A reported sometimes the medications are
distributed to youth in the hallway or on the recreation pod, and
previously youth would sit at the table during medication pass time
however this does not occur anymore. Youth A reported he was
not in his bedroom when Nurse had the medication cart on the
unit.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
6/25/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1
reported it was time to pass the evening medications and Youth A
“was cycling”. Staff 1 reported she indicated the youth should go
to their bedrooms as it was time to pass the night medication
however, she knew Youth A was not going to go into his bedroom
due to him “cycling”. Staff 1 reported Youth A stated he wanted his
medication and ran over to the medication cart and took two
2

medications that were prescribed to another youth. Staff 1 did not
recall what medications Youth A took. Staff 1 reported Nurse was
administering medications and she and Staff 2 were on the unit
working. Staff 1 reported Nurse went after Youth A to try to get
the medications. Staff 1 reported she was focused on cleaning up
the medications that fell to the floor and was unsure what
happened after. Staff 1 reported Nurse contacted poison control
and Youth A was monitored by Nurse the remainder of the night
for side effects. Staff 1 reported the process for administering
medication is to have the youth go into their bedrooms and sit at
their desk or bed with the bedroom doors open and Nurse goes
room to room and administers each youth’s medication.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
6/25/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2
reported all the youth on the unit were sitting at the table as they
were having a circle due to Youth A “struggling”. Nurse was
preparing to administer medications. Staff 2 reported she told the
youth to get into medication pass position meaning go to their
bedroom and sit at their desk or on their bed. Staff 2 reported
Youth A refused to go into his bedroom for medications to be
administered. Staff 2 reported Nurse pulled the medication cart
out onto the unit and Youth A ran over to the medication cart and
grabbed medications that were prepared to be dispensed. Nurse
completed an inventory of the medications to determine which
medications Youth A had taken and contacted poison control.
Staff 2 reported Nurse advised them to monitor Youth A for the
remainder of the evening. Staff 2 reported Youth A showed no
signs of side effects.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
6/25/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B
reported Youth A took medications off the medication cart. Youth
B was unable to recall which staff were present. Youth B reported
she went into her bedroom and did not know what occurred after
Youth A took the medications. Youth B reported when medications
are about to be administered, youth go into their bedrooms and sit
at their desk and one youth is called out of their bedroom at a time
to take their medication.
Nurse was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/25/2025
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Nurse reported he
prepared to administer the evening medications and brought the
medication cart onto the unit with medications on top that were
going to be administered. Nurse reported Staff 2 told the youth to
go to their bedrooms for medications to be administered. Nurse
3

reported Youth A stated he was going first and ran over to the
medication cart and grabbed medications off the top of the
medication cart. Nurse went after Youth A to attempt to stop
Youth A from taking the medications however Youth A took the
medications. Nurse reported he believed Youth A took two pills,
one of which was Veneflax and he could not recall the second
medication. Nurse reported he completed an inventory of the
medications to determine which pills Youth A had taken and
contacted poison control. Nurse reported poison control informed
him to have Youth A monitored for symptoms. Nurse advised
staff, unable to recall which staff, to monitor Youth A for vomiting.
Nurse reported Youth A displayed no symptoms. Nurse reported
the youth were out on the pod when he brought the medication
cart out. Nurse reported the typical procedure for passing
medication is for the youth to go into their bedrooms and sit on
their bed or at their desk and one youth is called out at a time to
take their medication. Nurse reported there have been times when
medications are passed when youth are in a circle but since this
incident, now youth go into their bedrooms. Nurse reported
medication pass procedure had gotten “a little lax” however this
was the first time a youth has taken medications off the cart that
were not prescribed to them.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
6/25/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth C
reported Nurse prepared to pass medications while the youth
were in a circle to discuss Youth A as Youth A was “cycling and
upset”. Youth C reported a peer made a statement that the
medication cart should not be brought out on the unit as Youth A
was upset. Youth C reported Youth A ran to the medication cart
and grabbed medications that were sitting on top of the
medication cart and shoved them in his mouth. Youth C reported
she did not recall all the details regarding what staff were present
or what staff did. Youth C reported a staff, unable to recall who,
called poison control.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
6/25/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth D
reported Nurse brought the medication cart onto the unit and she
told Nurse to put the medication cart away as Youth A was not
regulated enough for the medication cart to be out. Youth D
reported there were medications on top of the medication cart and
Youth A went and took some medications off the cart. Youth D
reported Nurse and staff, unable to recall which staff, told Youth A
to spit the medications out however Youth A stated he swallowed
the medications. Youth D reported normally when medications are
4

administered, youth go sit in their bedrooms and youth are called
out one by one to take their medications. Youth D reported since
Youth A took the medications off the cart, now the medications are
kept in the cart and the medications are popped out of the blister
pack when the youth come out one by one to take their
medications.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 6/11/2025 in Youth A’s pod was reviewed on
6/25/2025. Nurse was on the unit with the medication cart and the
youth were on the unit, some sitting at the table and others
walking around the unit. Youth A stood up from the chair, walked
over to the medication cart and took medications off the top of the
medication cart. Nurse followed Youth A to attempt to get the
medications. Youth A appeared to take the medication as her
hand went to her mouth.
Documents Reviewed:
• Policy 381- Medication Administration: The Bay Pines
Center Nurse is responsible for administering the
medication to youth Monday through Friday. Staff must
directly observe the youth swallow the medication and do a
visual check of the youth’s mouth to ensure the medication
is swallowed. Youth must never be allowed to open the
medicine carts or get their own medication, either
prescription or over the counter. Youth will step in their
rooms for medication pass. Staff will administer medication
on an individual basis with the designated medication cart.
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 214480266 dated 6/11/2025 for Youth A:
Youth A walked up to the medication cart and was able to
grab medication that was prepared for another youth that
was also walking to the medication cart to take their
medication. Youth A ran to the other side of the pod and
staff quickly intervened and attempted to prevent Youth A
from ingesting the medications. Youth A was able to ingest
Venlafaxine ER 75mg capsule and Oxtellar XR 600mg.
Staff walked with Youth A to a less stimulating environment
while helping Youth A with Mandt de-escalation. Facility
nurse contact poison control which recommended Youth A
be monitored for nauseousness, drowsiness, and vomiting.
Youth A was monitored and displayed no symptoms.
5

• Bay Pines Safety Plan dated 7/10/2025: Staff will follow the
medication pass policy and ensure the only medication on
the cart when a youth is being administered their
medication is the specific youth’s medications. If a youth
refuses to go into their bedroom for medications to be
administered, youth will be administered their medication
on the recreation pod with the unit’s door closed.
• Nurse personnel file: Nurse had no discipline in his
personnel file. Nurse received medication training on
3/19/2025 and 3/20/2025.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as the facilities policy is for
youth to be in their bedrooms when medications are administered.
Per interviews and video footage review, the youth were on the
unit when Nurse brought the medication cart out with medications
sitting on top of the cart and Youth A was able to take medications
that were not prescribed to him.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
The facility should update their internal medication policy to
include expectation for staff to pass medications if a youth is
refusing to go into their bedroom to align with the facilities safety
plan that was created 7/10/2025.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2024C0000843SI dated 11/21/2023, CAP Approved
12/15/2023
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4162
Section Seclusion within secure and nonsecure facilities; seclusion plan;
Description prohibitions; reduction and elimination
(11) All seclusion will be prohibited effective November 1, 2022.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth was secluded after two incidents.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
6/25/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A
reported after he took the medications he was put in his bedroom
until the next morning. Youth A reported he asked to come out of
his bedroom but was not allowed out and his bedroom door was
closed. Youth A reported he did not recall why he was in his
bedroom. Youth A reported he asked to come out of his bedroom
and his bedroom door was opened thirty minutes prior to step in
time for bed.
6

Youth A reported his arm/wrist area was shut in his bedroom door.
Youth A reported Staff 3 and Staff 4 were working, and he did not
recall all the events leading up to incident. Youth A reported he
was in his bedroom, however, did not recall why, and Staff 3
“slammed” his bedroom door on his arm/wrist. Youth A reported
Physician Assistant came and looked at his wrist/arm and
provided him with ice. Youth A reported he was taken in for a
Xray and there is no fracture however his arm/wrist still hurts.
Youth A’s right wrist area was viewed to be swollen. Youth A
reported he went on the slip and slide after his wrist/arm was
closed in the door and his wrist/arm has felt numb since. He can
feel a hard piece in his wrist. Youth A reported a new medical slip
was completed for him to see Nurse when Nurse is back at the
facility today.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
6/25/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1
reported she did not remember if Youth A came out of his
bedroom after taking the medications that night or why Youth A
was in his bedroom.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
6/25/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2
reported Youth A went into his bedroom after taking the
medication, however did not recall why. Staff 2 reported she did
not recall if Youth A’s bedroom door was open or closed however
believed initially the bedroom door was closed and later opened.
Staff 2 did not recall if Youth A came out of his bedroom after
taking the medication.
Physician Assistant was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 6/25/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Physician Assistant reported he was at the facility on 6/13/2025
when Youth A’s hand got injured and he examined Youth A within
an hour of the incident occurring. Physician Assistant reported to
his knowledge Youth A’s bedroom door was being closed and
Youth A stuck his hand out and the door closed on his hand.
Physician Assistant reported Youth A had tenderness and was
emotional when he examined him. Physician Assistant reported
Youth A had some range of motion and was provided with ice and
informed to rest his hand. Physician Assistant reported a Xray
was completed a few days later and showed no fracture.
Physician Assistant reported Youth A had soft tissue swelling.
7

Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
6/25/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B
reported Youth A was in his bedroom after taking the medications
as staff, unknown who, put Youth A into his bedroom due to Youth
A “acting out”.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
6/25/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth C
reported she “thought” Youth A went into his bedroom for the
remainder of the night and did not recall if she saw Youth A after
he took the medications. Youth C reported Youth A was in his
bedroom yelling and screaming. Youth C reported Youth A’s
bedroom door was closed. Youth C reported Youth A gets put in
his bedroom when Youth A is unsafe as staff will escort Youth A to
his bedroom. Youth C reported staff will carry or escort Youth A to
his room by securing Youth A’s arms. Youth C reported if a youth
refuses to go to their bedroom staff will grab the youth’s arms and
legs and carry the youth by lifting the youth’s body. Youth C
reported she has never seen Youth A be carried to his bedroom
and she has not seen any youth carried to their bedrooms since
being at the facility this time.
Nurse was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/25/2025
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Nurse reported Youth A
was in his bedroom after he took the medications. Nurse reported
he worked until 9pm that night and did checks on Youth A who he
believed was in his bedroom with the door open the remainder of
the night with a one-on-one staff monitoring him.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 7/8/2025
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported on
6/13/2025 Youth A was threatening him and went to punch him
resulting in Staff 3 and Staff 4 placing Youth A in an escort hold to
walk Youth A to his bedroom to talk to Youth A in a less
stimulating environment. Staff 4 reported once Youth A was
walked into his bedroom and released from the hold, Youth A
continued to be escalated and “it was clear he was going to
attack.” Staff 3 and Staff 4 step out of Youth A’s bedroom and
went to close the door and Youth A placed his hand in the door.
Staff 4 reported Youth A’s bedroom door was being closed to
have Youth A sit on his bed and demonstrate he was going to be
safe for Staff 4 to open the door and talk to him. Staff 4 reported
once he realized Youth A’s hand was in the door he immediately
loosed the door and asked Youth A to remove his hand and Youth
A did. Staff 4 realized Youth A was hurt as Youth A was yelling,
and Staff 4 opened the door to assess what occurred. Staff 4
8

reported the facilities Physician Assistant was onsite and called to
assess Youth A’s hand. Staff 4 reported he attempted to talk to
Youth A, but Youth A was refusing to talk and told Staff 4 to leave
him alone at which time Staff 4 closed Youth A’s bedroom door.
Staff 4 reported Youth A was not secluded in his bedroom and
Youth A never asked to come out. Staff 4 reported he was not
working on the unit that day and completed a few checks on Youth
A while he was in his bedroom, however Youth A never asked to
come out and continued to tell Staff 4 to leave him alone. Staff 4
reported he did not know when Youth A came out of his bedroom.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 7/8/2025
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported Youth A
attempted to assault Staff 4 resulting in Youth A being placed in
an escort hold and walked to his bedroom for Staff 3 and Staff 4 to
talk to Youth A. Staff 3 reported Youth A attempted to “charge” at
Staff 3 and Staff 4 once released from the escort hold and Staff 4
went to close Youth A’s bedroom door and Youth A placed his
hand in the door. Staff 3 reported the door bounced open and
Staff 3 and Staff 4 realized Youth A’s arm was in the door as the
doors automatically close when pulled closed. Staff 3 reported
Youth A moved his hand, and the door closed. Staff 4 opened
Youth A’s door and talked to Youth A and had medical staff come
assess Youth A’s hand. Staff 3 reported Youth A was yelling at
Staff 3 and Staff 4 to leave him alone. Staff 3 reported Youth A
was in his room and was not secluded at any time during this as
Youth A was stating he wanted to be left alone. Staff 3 reported
Youth A asked to come out of his bedroom once he was
regulated, and Youth A’s door was opened. Staff 3 reported Youth
A’s door was closed while Youth A was in his bedroom as Youth A
did not want his bedroom door open and asked to be left alone.
Staff 3 reported Youth A can recognize when he is becoming over
stimulated and will ask to go to his bedroom as it is a less
stimulating environment.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 6/13/2025 on Youth A’s unit was reviewed on
6/25/2025 and 7/8/2025. Staff 3 and Staff 4 walked out of Youth
A’s bedroom and Staff 4 pulled the door closed. The door
appeared to be cracked slightly, and Youth A could be heard
yelling. The door slightly opened and closed. Youth A continued to
scream and Staff 4 opened Youth A’s bedroom door. Youth A
remained in his bedroom with the door closed. Staff completed
checks on Youth A and at times opened Youth A’s door and stood
in Youth A’s bedroom doorway, however it cannot be heard what
was discussed. Youth A exited his bedroom at 1:31pm.
9

Video footage of 6/11/2025 on Youth A’s unit was reviewed on
7/8/2025. Youth A’s bedroom door was closed with Youth A inside
at 7:21pm. All youth are in their bedrooms for medications to be
administered. Staff are observed to go to Youth A’s door, open
Youth A’s door, and close the door. Youth A’s door remained
closed.
Documents Reviewed:
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 214480266 dated 6/11/2025 for Youth A:
When Youth A was calm, he decided to self-step into his
room.
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 214650263 dated 6/13/2025 for Youth A:
Youth A was upset when staff asked Youth A to work on
completing morning responsibilities. Staff offered to help
Youth A while using Mandt de-escalation. Youth A refused
to help and began using racial slurs and throwing items
across the pod. Staff continued to help Youth A while using
more Mandt de-escalation. Youth A attempted to intimidate
staff by “posturing” and then made swinging motions with
fists towards staff. Youth A was placed in a Mandt secure
hold to escort Youth A to a less stimulating/safer
environment. During the escort Youth A began to resist
and fought back causing this to be a restraint. Once staff
had Youth A in a safer location, staff attempted to process
with Youth A but Youth A demanded that staff leave the
area and close the door. As staff was closing the door,
Youth A stuck his hand in the doorway causing the door to
hit his wrist when it closed.
• SOP Seclusion: Youth are not to be secluded in their rooms
without administrative approval. Youth are allowed to step
in their room on their own.
• Department of Health and Human Services Seclusion
Variance Approval for Bay Pines Center dated 4/28/2025:
The facility is approved to use seclusion as a temporary
response to prevent life-threatening injury or serious bodily
harm when other interventions are ineffective and
authorized by an administrator.
10

• Bay Pines Medical documentation for Youth A dated
6/13/2025: Youth A was assessed by Physician Assistant
due to right wrist contusion due to wrist being closed in
door.
• Bay Pines Imaging Requisition Form for Youth A dated
6/16/2025.
• St. Francis Hospital X-Ray results for Youth A dated
6/16/2025: Findings show soft tissue swelling, no evidence
of a fracture.
• Staff 3 and Staff 4’s personnel file: Staff 3 and Staff 4 had
no discipline. Staff 3 received training regarding seclusion
on 5/16/2025 and Staff 4 on 6/23/2025.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance. Youth A reported he was
secluded in his bedroom following the incident where his hand
was closed in the door and following him taking medications that
were not prescribed to him, however, there is insufficient
information to indicate if the youth was secluded.
Per interviews regarding Youth A being in his bedroom after he
took medications that were not prescribed to him, it is unclear if
seclusion occurred as Youth A and Youth C report Youth A was
put in his bedroom, however staff interviews are not very clear as
staff do not specifically recall/remember and believed Youth A
may have gone in his room but do not recall why. Per the incident
report dated 6/11/2025 Youth A self-steeped into his bedroom.
Per interviews regarding Youth A being secluded following his
hand being closed in the bedroom door, Staff 3 and Staff 4
reported Youth A was not secluded rather Youth A requested staff
leave him alone at which time Youth A’s door was closed and
when Youth A requested to come out of his bedroom Youth A was
let out.
CONSULTATION:
The facility was offered consultation regarding having
documentation to indicate if a youth requested to go into their
room and if the youth requested their bedroom door remain open
or closed.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
11

Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
7/14/2025
___________________________________________
Jennifer Pastorick Date
Licensing Consultant
